Description: Funerary papyrus of Tasheretenkhons Gepor containing Second Book of Breathing (abridged version, with some original elements) written in hieratic script verso and recto.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 10123 probably inside the now lost coffin of Senchonsis in the collective tomb of the archon Soter (see Herbin 2008, 104).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 104-105, pls. 64-67.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (246)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.104-105, pls.64-67)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57791) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57791)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 July - September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape. Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
